vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
μυκτηρ-ίζω,
turn up the nose, sneer at, [LXX+5th c.BC+]:—passive, to be mocked, [LXX]: hence, to be outwitted, [NT]
__II bleed at the nose, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: (passive) to be mocked, treated with contempt mock
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
(passive) to be mocked, treated with contempt mock
to contract the nose in contempt and derision, toss up the nose; to mock, deride, treat with contempt Gal. 6:7*
